isis.stitle: FRONT AXLES: INTERNATIONAL BY SPICER I-BEAM - KING PIN BUSHING REPLACEMENT - STEERING KNUCKLE INSTALLATION

step1.para: Before installing the king pins, lubricate inside of bushings and outside of king pins with Fleetrite EP2 Moly Grease or equivalent NLGI No. 2 multi-purpose lithium grease to provide initial lubrication.
Make certain that knuckle pin hole in axle center is clean and dry.
There may be two styles of thrust bearings. One Type is installed on thrust bearing with seal on top ( Figure 16). Position and support the steering knuckle assembly on the axle end.
The second style thrust ing is a one piece design with the seal lip installed towards the bottom of the knuckles as shown in Figure 17 .
Slide spacer shim(s) between upper face of axle and upper steering knuckle yoke.
Slide the thrust bearing between the lower face of axle center and lower steering knuckle yoke.
Align the steering knuckle yoke holes with axle and thrust bearing holes.
Install king pin from the top taking care to align notch with draw key holes in I-beam.

note.para: The machined flats are located closer to the top of the king pin to allow installation of the thrust bearing, while maintaining correct vertical position of king pin. The flats are also wider than the draw key allowing slight adjustment. The king pin must be vertically centered in the knuckle. This allows both top and bottom king pin end caps to be installed without interference.

step1.para: Install draw keys as follows. (Apply chassis grease in draw key bores.)
Threaded draw keys on axle codes 02ADC, 02ADD, 02ADE and 02ADG will replace staked draw keys.

step2.para: Install top draw key with the threaded end of key to front of axle as shown in Figure 18 .

figure.caption: Figure 18. Draw Key Installation To Front of Axle

step2.para: Install bottom draw key with threaded end to rear of axle. Stake draw key(s) at unthreaded ends by striking with brass drift and hammer. Do not tighten at this time.

step1.para: Place a jack under the lower side of steering knuckle yoke and raise knuckle so that all clearance is taken up between lower yoke, thrust bearing and lower face of axle center end ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Spindle Vertical End Play Check

step1.para: Check the clearance between the top face of upper axle center end and lower face of upper knuckle pin boss. Shims are available in various thicknesses to provide a desired clearance of .005 to .015 (.1270 - .3810 mm) ( Figure 19).
Tighten draw keys.

step2.para: Install draw key Belleville washers and nut to upper and lower keys.
Torque draw key nuts to 25 - 30 ft-lbs. (34 - 41 N·m).
Seat draw keys again and repeat step B.

step1.para: Install king pins caps and O-ring ( Figure 7). Torque cap bolts to 12 - 16 ft-lbs. (16 - 22 N·m).
To make sure the king pins will accept lubricant, lubricate upper and lower king pin bushings through the cap grease fittings before installing brake assembly.
Re-install tie rod and drag link to steering arms. Refer to GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Re-install brake components. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Clean and inspect the front wheel bearings. The bearings will either be grease or oil lubricated. Install the bearings in the hub assembly using new seals, and install hub assembly. Refer to the GROUP 17 - WHEELS, RIMS, AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install wheel and tire as instructed in GROUP 17 - WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove vehicle from floor stands.
Check and adjust toe-in. Refer to Group 02 - GENERAL SERVICE INFORMATION and FRONT WHEEL ALIGNMENT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
